title: How to Test a Kenmore Ultra Dishwasher for a Defective Control Board

steps.headline: Disconnect the power to the unit.
Remove the kick plate on the front at the bottom of the unit.
steps.description: Try to find a plastic pouch with a document for service technicians.

steps.headline: Find the section on the test steps for “Checking Keypad Operation”.
Unscrew the top six of so screws that hold the control panel in place.
steps.description: The screws are on the inside top portion of the door. You will need a special screwdriver, maybe the star type. The control panel should allow you to pull it out enough to angle the front of the panel toward the floor revealing the inside. Wires will prevent it from falling.

steps.headline: Remove the box on the inside of the control panel area covering the electronics.
steps.description: It has two latches on the right, one on the left and one on the top – you should be able to do this by hand. You can see the control board, wire connections, etc.

steps.headline: Remove the control board by depressing the two prongs from the control panel that hold it in place on the left side of the control board.
steps.description: Be prepared to support the control panel with your knees at this point.

steps.headline: Remove the green ribbon that attaches to the control board carefully.
steps.description: You will leave this detached for the test.

steps.headline: Put the control board back in place and the black box cover back over the control board and wires and re-attach the control panel to the door.
steps.description: At this point there should be no parts not reassembled. The only difference from where you found the dishwasher should be that the ribbon from the control panel is not attached to the control board. The unit should be ready for the test identified in the document.

steps.headline: Plug the dishwasher back into the outlet (power supply for the unit) with the door open, wait five seconds, close the door and get your results.
steps.description: The test indicates that if the dishwasher does nothing, the problem is the control board. If the result is that the drain pump ran for two minutes, the problem is the control panel.

text: Prepare the Unit Disconnect the power to the unit.  Remove the kick plate on the front at the bottom of the unit. Try to find a plastic pouch with a document for service technicians. Find the section on the test steps for “Checking Keypad Operation”.  Perform the Test Steps Unscrew the top six of so screws that hold the control panel in place. The screws are on the inside top portion of the door. You will need a special screwdriver, maybe the star type. The control panel should allow you to pull it out enough to angle the front of the panel toward the floor revealing the inside. Wires will prevent it from falling. Remove the box on the inside of the control panel area covering the electronics. It has two latches on the right, one on the left and one on the top – you should be able to do this by hand. You can see the control board, wire connections, etc. Remove the control board by depressing the two prongs from the control panel that hold it in place on the left side of the control board. Be prepared to support the control panel with your knees at this point. Remove the green ribbon that attaches to the control board carefully. You will leave this detached for the test. Put the control board back in place and the black box cover back over the control board and wires and re-attach the control panel to the door. At this point there should be no parts not reassembled. The only difference from where you found the dishwasher should be that the ribbon from the control panel is not attached to the control board. The unit should be ready for the test identified in the document. Plug the dishwasher back into the outlet (power supply for the unit) with the door open, wait five seconds, close the door and get your results. The test indicates that if the dishwasher does nothing, the problem is the control board. If the result is that the drain pump ran for two minutes, the problem is the control panel.
